intro: Roettlera gracilipes, commonly known as the slender roettlera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks. Roettlera gracilipes is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance.
